meanings.definition: To arrange in a certain order or classification.
meanings.sent1: I will sort my toys by color before putting them away.
meanings.sent2: She likes to sort her books alphabetically on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to sort the socks by smell, but it got confused.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a jumble of thoughts, like trying to sort a deck of cards in a hurricane.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to sort the shapes from smallest to largest.

meanings.definition: A category or type of something.
meanings.sent1: The library has a special section for that sort of book.
meanings.sent2: He prefers to read mysteries and thrillers, that sort of thing.
meanings.sent3: She always wears the same sort of hat, no matter the occasion.
meanings.sent4: His jokes were of the same tired sort, lacking originality.
meanings.sent5: The store sells all sorts of candies, from gummies to chocolates.

meanings.definition: To find out the nature of something.
meanings.sent1: I need to sort out what is causing the strange noise in the car.
meanings.sent2: The detective tried to sort out the clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent3: She tried to sort out her feelings about the situation, but it was difficult.
meanings.sent4: The scientist worked tirelessly to sort out the complexities of the experiment.
meanings.sent5: He needed time to sort out his thoughts before making a decision.
